member.name: M:ApiPort.ConsoleProgressReporter.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends all progress tasks.

member.name: T:ApiPort.FileOutputApiPortService
member.summary: Use this service implementation to output analyze requests to a json file

member.name: M:ApiPort.FileOutputApiPortService.SendAnalysisAsync(Microsoft.Fx.Portability.ObjectModel.AnalyzeRequest,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the analysis as . Input is ignored.

member.name: M:ApiPort.Program.IsWebSecurityFailureOnMono(System.Exception)
member.summary: Mono does not come installed with root certificates. If a user runs this without configuring them, they will receive a Mono.Security.Protocol.Tls.TlsException.

member.name: T:ApiPort.ConsoleCredentialProvider
member.summary: Credential provider for console input. Taken from: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/Common/ConsoleCredentialProvider.cs

member.name: M:ApiPort.ConsoleCredentialProvider.GetCredentialsAsync(System.Uri,System.Net.IWebProxy,Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.CredentialRequestType,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Fetches credentials for the given uri and proxy.

member.name: M:ApiPort.ConsoleCredentialProvider.ReadSecureStringFromConsole(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Using Console input, retrieves a SecureString

member.name: M:ApiPort.ConsoleCredentialProvider.ReadUnsecureStringFromConsole
member.summary: NOTE: Remove this when NetworkCredential.SecurePassword is available in .NET Standard 2.0.

member.name: T:ApiPort.Proxy.WebProxy
member.summary: Internal implementation of mirroring default desktop one.
member.remarks: Remove when WebProxy is brought to .NET Standard 2.0.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to API Portability Analyzer.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Description of submission.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeFileInput
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Path to assembly file or directory of assemblies.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeIgnoreAssembliesFile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies a json file defining assemblies that should not be analyzed for specific targets while analyzing breaking changes. This can be useful for excluding assemblies that are known to not regress on certain .NET Framework versions due to breaking changes. Note that, currently, this parameter only affects breaking change analysis and not portability analysis[.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Analyzes specified files/directories for IL and determines the APIs that are used. This information is analyzed for portability concerns or known breaking changes (depending on input parameters) and returns a report that gives a summary of issues and possible steps forward..

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeNoDefaultIgnoreFile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Do not use the standard assembly ignore list when analyzing breaking changes. The default ignore list can be found at KnownSafeBreaks.json.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeOutputFileName
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Output file name.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeResultFormat
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Format to display output results.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeShowBreakingChanges
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculate breaking changes on full .NET Framework.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeShowNonPortableApis
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculate non-portable APIs.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeShowRetargettingIssues
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Include the retargetting issues in the reports.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeSuppressBreakingChange
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies a breaking change (by ID) to suppress during breaking change analysis. Any breaking changes with IDs specified for suppression will not be reported..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The target against which to check portability.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.CmdAnalyzeTargetMap

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.Header
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Microsoft (R) {0} v{1} Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
This tool analyzes .NET assemblies to determine possible problems moving between .NET platforms (such as Windows Store, desktop, Mono, .NET Core, etc) as well as between .NET Framework versions (ie 4.x->4.y).
To learn more about how this tool works, including the data we are collecting, visit {2}.
For the full privacy statement, please visit {3}.

member.name: P:ApiPort.Resources.LocalizedStrings.TargetUsage
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to In order to specify a target, run the tool with the following command switch: ApiPort.exe analyze -t "(Target Name)" [other args]
In order to specify a version, please specify a target and a version with the following switch: ApiPort.exe analyze -t "(Target Name), Version=(Version)" [other args]
Versions marked with an asterisk (*) implies that these are default targets if none are submitted..

member.name: T:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyConstants
member.summary: Constants used to fetch proxy settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyConstants.HttpProxy
member.summary: Environment variable key to specify the value to use as the HTTP proxy for all connections.For example, HTTP_PROXY="http://proxy.mycompany.com:8080/"

member.name: F:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyConstants.NoProxy
member.summary: Environment variable key to determine hosts that should bypass the proxy. For example, NO_PROXY="localhost,.mycompany.com,192.168.0.10:80"

member.name: T:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyProvider
member.summary:
Looks for a proxy in the following order: 1. From a configuration file 2. From an environment variable 3. System provided proxy
Looks for the one in the configuration file because the user would explicitly want to override their current proxy settings in order for the configuration value to be set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyProvider.GetUserConfiguredProxy
member.summary: Tries to get user configured proxy in the following order: 1. Environment (configured in http_proxy, no proxy) 2. Configuration file passed in.
member.returns: A web proxy or null if none was found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyProvider.GetWebProxyFromEnvironment
member.summary: Gets the proxy from environment variables.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyProvider.GetWebProxyFromConfiguration
member.summary: Tries to create a proxy by reading values from .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Fx.Portability.Proxy.ProxyProvider.CredentialsWrapper
member.summary: Helper class that wraps NetworkCredentials so the proxy always has a reference to the same class.
